title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
lucaa joined #xwiki at 00:07 lucaa left at 00:18 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds lucaa joined #xwiki at 00:18 jvelociter joined #xwiki at 00:33 sdumitriu left at 00:35 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds jvelociter left at 00:45 (Quit: jvelociter florinciu left at 01:03 (Read error: Connection reset by peer SvenDowideit left at 01:25 (Changing host SvenDowideit joined #xwiki at 01:25 lucaa left at 01:31 (Read error: Connection reset by peer lucaa joined #xwiki at 01:31 lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 01:33 lucaa left at 01:33 (Read error: Connection reset by peer lucaa1 left at 01:35 (Client Quit lucaa joined #xwiki at 01:38 lucaa left at 01:41 (Read error: No route to host lucaa joined #xwiki at 01:41 rrodriguez left at 01:45 (Quit: rrodriguez lucaa left at 01:49 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds lucaa joined #xwiki at 01:50 lucaa left at 01:55 (Client Quit lucaa joined #xwiki at 01:59 lucaa left at 02:01 (Client Quit lucaa joined #xwiki at 02:02 abusenius left at 02:03 (Ping timeout: 255 seconds lucaa left at 02:21 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds Denis left at 07:02 (Read error: Connection reset by peer Denis1 joined #xwiki at 07:08 mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:57 sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 08:14 rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 08:17 rrodriguez - (08:23): sdumitriui: ping Vitafuris joined #xwiki at 08:37 Vitafuris - (08:37): Hello rrodriguez - (08:42): Vitafuris: Hello Vitafuris - (08:48): I'me looking for a wiki to my company and Xwiki looks really nice for the job Vitafuris - (08:51): I do have a question though Vitafuris - (08:51): I foud really information about customization of the pdf export Vitafuris - (08:52): is there any examples or tutorials? Stulle joined #xwiki at 08:53 rrodriguez - (08:56): Vitafuris: check this... http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HCustomizingthePDFexportLook26Feel rrodriguez - (08:57): this will give a nice idea about the work being currently done: http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/RenderingModule Vitafuris - (08:58): oki, I'll check this Vitafuris - (08:58): thanks rrodriguez :-D rrodriguez - (08:58): Please, thing about XWiki not only a wiki system, but as a complete development framework rrodriguez - (08:59): you are welcome! I do hope you'll enjoy XWiki as I do! :-) Stulle left at 09:01 (Quit: Page closed Stulle joined #xwiki at 09:01 Stulle - (09:01): nice rrodriguez! rrodriguez - (09:02): Stulle: hi! please, could you take a look at this sentence: rrodriguez - (09:02): After the export request triggers XWiki ExportAction, the content of your document is parsed by Velocity to get the initial XHTML content. JTidy, a HTML/XHTML syntax checker and pretty printer, will clean the initial XHTML to make it XHTML compliant. No customization is possible in this step. rrodriguez - (09:03): I've not a clear idea about how/where to use HTML and where to use XHTML rrodriguez - (09:03): Thanks! rrodriguez - (09:05): Stulle: I've to leave now! Talk to you later! rrodriguez left at 09:05 (Quit: rrodriguez Stulle - (09:05): uff, problem is, i am not too familiar with that kind of stuff. but for all i can figure out XHTML is just an extension of HTML so it would actually be up to one of the devs to determine if XHTML extensions are being used in the parsed data or not sdumitriu - (09:07): Stulle: Hi sdumitriu - (09:07): What do you mean by "Mentioned fix works on entire tables, however, it is still broken for cells with multiple lines using the group markup ((( )))" sdumitriu - (09:07): What doesn't work? Stulle - (09:08): hold on a minute, on the phone Stulle - (09:11): okay, done on the phone Stulle - (09:12): so about what i meant, if i make a table with cells with line breaks within i use code like this: Stulle - (09:12): |((( Stulle - (09:12): my first line Stulle - (09:12): my second line Stulle - (09:12): )))|second cell Stulle - (09:13): now, adding (% style="vertical-align: bottom" %) between | and ((( has no effect Stulle - (09:13): am i making sense to you? vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:17 vmassol - (09:29): good morning guys vmassol - (09:29): we need to stabilize the2.6 RC1 release today at latest vmassol - (09:30): there are lots of tests failing: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/lastBuild/testReport/ vmassol - (09:30): 26 in total Vitafuris left at 09:30 (Quit: Page closed vmassol - (09:31): I'm taking this one: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/119/testReport/org.xwiki.it.ui/AttachmentTest/testDocumentAddTwoAttachments/ sburjan joined #xwiki at 09:33 vmassol - (09:41): cjdelisle: good morning sdumitriu left #xwiki at 09:52 marta\_ joined #xwiki at 09:53 sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:53 vmassol - (09:55): ah funny thing this test fails because of the icon  transformation vmassol - (09:56): (causing a java.lang.StackOverflowError) vmassol - (09:56): analyzing... arkub joined #xwiki at 09:57 sdumitriu - (09:57): Stulle: Your example works fine for me Stulle - (09:58): hold on sburjan - (09:58): sdumitriu: I'm gonna file the bug from yesterday sdumitriu - (09:58): Note that there's a margin around the paragraphs inside the cell, so the text won't be exactly at the bottom Stulle - (09:58): i know. okay, what i did is the following Stulle - (09:59): i added (% style="vertical-align: middle" %) before the table (top being the default in the styles.css) sdumitriu - (09:59): Try this: sdumitriu - (09:59): (% style="vertical-align: bottom; text-align: right; width: 100px;" %) sdumitriu - (09:59): |= a |= b sdumitriu - (09:59): |(% style="vertical-align: top" %)((( sdumitriu - (09:59): c sdumitriu - (09:59): d sdumitriu - (09:59): e))) | fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn sdumitriu - (09:59): |((( sdumitriu - (09:59): c sdumitriu - (09:59): d sdumitriu - (09:59): e))) | fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn fghijklmn Stulle - (09:59): then i added (% style="vertical-align: bottom" %) before one of th emultiline tables Stulle - (10:00): s/tables/cells Stulle - (10:02): oh, i think i know what is causing it for me Stulle - (10:02): okay, so i actually got colspan cells there Stulle - (10:02): so from the import it has (% colspan="4" %) there Stulle - (10:03): then i think i aligned it in the WYSIWYG editor and it appended (% style="text-align: right" %) right of that Stulle - (10:03): so it's (% colspan="4")(% style=... %) Stulle - (10:04): and that makes the vertical-align style go unnoticed Stulle - (10:04): interestingly enough it does work for text-align Stulle - (10:06): just to make sure you understand what i got there: (% colspan="4" %)(% style="text-align: right; vertical-align: bottom" %) Stulle - (10:07): this works to make colspan and text-align but not vertical align work Stulle - (10:07): to make vertical-align work i need to use: (% colspan="4" style="text-align: right; vertical-align: bottom" %) sburjan - (10:08): sdumitriu: running on trunk and I can't see any escapingTools class in my instance. About the escape bug from yesterday. sburjan - (10:08): it should be between ColorThemes and Invitation. But I don't have it jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:09 sburjan - (10:09): i'll test a 2.5 sdumitriu - (10:09): sburjan: You have to create a class in a space, then deny view rights on that space sburjan - (10:10): and then what .. I should have the escaping tools in my objects list ? sdumitriu - (10:12): Yes sdumitriu - (10:12): But not as Admin asrfel joined #xwiki at 10:16 sburjan - (10:23): sdumitriu: If I deny the view rights in that space I can't see anything in that space ... sburjan - (10:24): as a normal user sburjan - (10:24): I'm trying to reproduce the image evlica sent yesterday jvelociter joined #xwiki at 10:44 lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:45 lucaa left at 10:47 (Client Quit vmassol - (10:49): ok found the problem vmassol - (10:49): fixing vmassol - (10:51): fyi the issue is because NewLineBlock is a singleton lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 10:51 vmassol - (10:51): (so getnextsibling fails when there's more than 1 NL since it returns always the first one, thus the inifinte loop) rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:52 lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:55 rrodriguez\_ joined #xwiki at 10:55 lucaa1 left at 10:55 (Read error: No route to host rrodriguez left at 10:59 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds rrodriguez\_ is now known as rrodriguez ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) sburjan - (11:00): vmassol: ping lucaa left at 11:00 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds vmassol - (11:01): sburjan: pong vmassol - (11:01): sburjan: btw any issue you've found for the 2.6RC1 release? mflorea left at 11:01 (Quit: Leaving. sburjan - (11:02): I am looking at your commit ( 32249) regarding of the renaming of the org.xwiki.it.ui to org.xwiki.test.ui sburjan - (11:03): I have svn up the files, but they don't reflect the change, neither in classes (import ...) nor in directory structure sburjan - (11:03): am I doing something wrong ? lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:03 vmassol - (11:05): sburjan: it's easy to know vmassol - (11:05): check http://svn.xwiki.org sburjan - (11:05): yeah ... vmassol - (11:07): probably because y'oure not svn upping the right thing sburjan - (11:07): I upped ui-tests and I upped the whole enterprise vmassol - (11:07): on trunk? vmassol - (11:07): you sure you're not on 2.5 branch vmassol - (11:07): ? sburjan - (11:08): odd this is that svn showed the correct path (with test) and the flags U sburjan - (11:08): oh.. wait sburjan - (11:09): well the svn checkout was created on 2.5, now I just svn upped vmassol - (11:09): argh…. new NewLineBlock() now makes AbstractBlockMacro fail checkstyle with fan out too large.... sburjan - (11:09): let me get a fresh copy of latest vmassol - (11:09): sburjan: you're mixing branches as I said sburjan - (11:10): interesting. I didn't kew that svn up cand change it's path from where it takes it's updates. sburjan - (11:10): \*knew vmassol - (11:10): what? vmassol - (11:10): that doesn't make sense sburjan - (11:11): 2 months ago I svn checkout http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/enterprise/trunk/ .Since then, I only svn up to bring updates. This is the only thing I've done. In the meantime, we we created 2.6 trunk .. sburjan - (11:13): but the svn up link is the same I guess ... so now I should have the 2.6 trunk when issuing svn up, right ? vmassol - (11:13): check .svn/entries rrodriguez - (11:16): please, could anybody check if this paragraph is correcto? "After the export request triggers XWiki ExportAction, the content of your document is parsed by Velocity to get the initial XHTML content. JTidy, a HTML/XHTML syntax checker and pretty printer, will clean the initial XHTML to make it XHTML compliant. No customization is possible in this step." rrodriguez - (11:16): I've introduced it in this document... rrodriguez - (11:17): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HCustomizingthePDFexportLook26Feel rrodriguez - (11:18): I read here... http://jtidy.sourceforge.net/ that JTidy is a "HTML syntax checker and pretty printer"; I've added XTML there.. "HTML/XHTML syntax checker and pretty printer" rrodriguez - (11:18): please, is that correct? I don't want to introduce confusion about this! rrodriguez - (11:18): Thanks! sburjan - (11:25): vmassol: figured it out. svn kept the old structure directory with it's data too, and added the new one too :) So basically now I have both versions :| sburjan - (11:26):  org.xwiki.it.ui  AND org.xwiki.test.ui sburjan - (11:26): I'll play with it to learn more on how it works marta\_1 joined #xwiki at 11:29 marta\_ left at 11:30 (Quit: Leaving. vmassol - (12:19): (would need to measure that to be sure) vmassol - (12:19): the functional ui-test should be fixed now vmassol - (12:19): bbiab sdumitriu - (12:20): rrodriguez: Yes, that is correct rrodriguez - (12:20): sdumitriu: thanks Enygma` joined #xwiki at 12:49 vmassol - (13:16): guys we need to stabilize the release now vmassol - (13:16): please don't add new stuff and instead help fixing failing tests vmassol - (13:16): you can add new stuff in the RC2 vmassol - (13:16): btw vmassol - (13:16): hmmm vmassol - (13:16): we were supposed to have 2 features: send mail + recent activity vmassol - (13:17): but none are committed vmassol - (13:17): this means less time to test them mflorea joined #xwiki at 13:17 vmassol - (13:18): sdumitriu: any update on your side re mail this page? flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 13:19 vmassol - (13:20): sdumitriu: raluca says her patch is ready vmassol - (13:20): do you have time to commit it today? rstavro joined #xwiki at 13:22 sdumitriu - (13:26): vmassol: Yes, I'll look at her patch soon vmassol - (13:28): sdumitriu: ok cool; On my side I'll be unavail starting in 1 hour vmassol - (13:28): (going to the funerals and then week end + bank holiday on monday) vmassol - (13:28): (and I'm trying hard not to use my computer during weekends/holidays …. it's hard but I need to practice....) vmassol - (13:29): sdumitriu: and the mailt  to page? sdumitriu - (13:30): I didn't have any time at all for it sdumitriu - (13:31): I'll work on it during the weekend vmassol - (13:31): sdumitriu: so for RC2 I guess vmassol - (13:31): RC1 sounds a bit too short in timing vmassol - (13:31): (I think it's ok if it's early in RC2) sdumitriu - (13:31): Yes sdumitriu - (13:31): Actually, maybe RC1 should be named M1 sdumitriu - (13:31): Since it does have new features vmassol - (13:31): yes maybe vmassol - (13:31): but that has a cost now vmassol - (13:32): all the @since tags in the code would need to be modified vmassol - (13:32): for this release RC meant stable, not "no new features" abusenius joined #xwiki at 13:38 vmassol - (13:39): guys 6 webstandards failures: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/121/testReport/ vmassol - (13:39): have we changed something recently? vmassol - (13:40): btw there's a strange {pre} at line 308 in http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/121/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_Invitation\_\_page\_WebPreferences\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/ vmassol - (13:40): any idea? sdumitriu - (13:46): WebPreferences needs to be revisited vmassol - (13:46): sdumitriu: someone made a change in it? sdumitriu - (13:46): Seems the {pre}{/pre} is breaking the tests sdumitriu - (13:47): I'll check vmassol - (13:48): the P is wrong here too: vmassol - (13:48): 391

vmassol - (13:48): 392 vmassol - (13:48): 393

vmassol - (13:48): 394

vmassol - (13:48): (the closing one) vmassol - (13:48): http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/121/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_\_xwiki\_bin\_admin\_XWiki\_XWikiPreferences\_editor\_globaladmin\_section\_General\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/ vmassol - (13:49): jvelociter: maybe your change has impacted this test: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/121/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/SchedulerTest/testJobActions/ ? vmassol - (13:50): (I haven't checked, I just remember you touched the scheduler app I think) jvelociter - (13:50): vmassol: I don't think so jvelociter - (13:50): I've dig it and it seems the issue is a core issue vmassol - (13:50): jvdrean: wow then it's a blocker jvelociter - (13:51): my take would be it's the AS changes - though I'm not sure jvelociter - (13:51): yes it is very blocker jvelociter - (13:51): :) vmassol - (13:51): sdumitriu:  you're aware of it? jvelociter - (13:51): I can try to dig a little this afternoon if nobody else is available sdumitriu - (13:51): Why would the AS changes cause this? jvelociter - (13:51): I don't know but it matches in time with the commits vmassol - (13:52): sdumitriu: seems PDF export fails too: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-misc/121/testReport/org.xwiki.test.misc/PDFTest/testExportSingleSimplePageAsPDF/ sdumitriu - (13:52): But it's transparent code sdumitriu - (13:52): It just fires a few notifications jvdrean left at 13:52 (Quit: Leaving. jvelociter - (13:52): or it is something else, I don't know flaviusolaru left at 13:53 (Read error: Connection reset by peer vmassol - (13:53): abusenius: still working on fixing the last 10 tests in error at http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/121/testReport/ ? :) jvdrean joined #xwiki at 13:53 abusenius - (13:55): vmassol: well, I know what causes them, but I don't really have time to work on them at the moment sburjan - (13:59): I also see a failing ui-test ... cjdelisle wrote afaik vmassol - (13:59): abusenius: it's a pain to receive hudson mails for them if we're not fixing them vmassol - (13:59): sburjan: I fixed it sburjan - (13:59): okay vmassol - (13:59): got to go sdumitriu - (14:00): vmassol: The problem with {pre} is that the admin app was migrated to 2.0, and the WebPreferences docs are still in 1.0 sdumitriu - (14:00): There's a rendering issue with including from a 1.0 document a 2.0 sheet abusenius - (14:01): vmassol: I can exclude them from tests to give a nice false sense of security :) sdumitriu - (14:02): abusenius: No, leave them abusenius - (14:03): if anyone is interested in working on it, here are some bugs: abusenius - (14:03): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-724 abusenius - (14:03): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XABLOG-110 abusenius - (14:04): + we have unescaped velocity in some translations which I haven't reported afair arkub left at 14:22 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds sdumitriu - (15:00): vmassol: webstandards tests should be fixed lucaa left at 15:11 (Read error: Connection reset by peer lucaa joined #xwiki at 15:12 jvelociter - (15:13): wow that scheduler thing is very weird jvelociter - (15:13): the SchedulerJobClass object has no "status" field in memory jvelociter - (15:14): but it has everything else jvelociter - (15:14): and the status field is properly defined in the XClass jvelociter - (15:14): still digging arkub joined #xwiki at 15:22 jvelociter - (15:27): OK I might have a clue, the scheduler plugin is doing something odd : http://pastebin.com/TiphEXxA jvelociter - (15:28): it gets the document from an object, then modifies that object and save jvelociter - (15:28): I have no idea what change could have affected that behavior sdumitriu - (15:32): jvelociter: I have a clue sdumitriu - (15:33): Something similar to XWIKI-1962 sdumitriu - (15:33): Hm, actually no abusenius left at 15:33 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds sdumitriu - (15:33): Or yes sdumitriu - (15:33): Definitely that sdumitriu - (15:34): The way it used to work: sdumitriu - (15:34): doc.getObject => returns the object from the document in the cache sdumitriu - (15:34): Now: sdumitriu - (15:34): doc.getObject => clone the document, return the object from the clone jvelociter - (15:35): OK jvelociter - (15:35): since the fix for 1962 ? sdumitriu - (15:35): So calling context.getWiki().getDocument(object.getName(), context); returns a different document than the one where the object came from sdumitriu - (15:35): The code in saveStatus is wrong, it only worked because of a bug jvelociter - (15:35): I think what the scheduler is doing is wrong anyway jvelociter - (15:35): yes asrfel left at 15:36 (Quit: Leaving. jvelociter - (15:36): but it's not https://fisheye2.atlassian.com/changelog/xwiki?cs=30816 asrfel joined #xwiki at 15:36 jvelociter - (15:36): otherwise 2.5 would have the bug asrfel left at 15:36 (Client Quit sdumitriu - (15:37): There were other similar fixes in the code sdumitriu - (15:38): Anyway, the code is broken jvelociter - (15:38): yep jvelociter - (15:38): (just trying to find a commit/JIRA to reference jvelociter - (15:38): ) jvelociter - (15:38): maybe Caleb would know jvelociter - (15:49): ah ! the bug is in 2.5 acutally jvelociter - (15:54): hmm I wonder how I should create the JIRA issue. It should be in XAASCH since it's scheduler plugin code, but the Affect field will not have much sense, since it depends of the version of XWiki used jvelociter - (15:54): sdumitriu: wdyt ? should it be created in XWIKI ? sdumitriu - (15:55): No sdumitriu - (15:55): In XASCH since you'll commit the code there sdumitriu - (15:55): The bug was in previous versions of XASCH, it didn't manifest itself jvelociter - (15:57): ok fine Stulle - (16:05): bye everyone, have a pleasant weekend sdumitriu - (16:07): Stulle: Wait a bit sdumitriu - (16:08): Are you OK with closing XSCOLIBRI-239 ? Stulle left at 16:10 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds arkub left at 16:11 (Quit: Leaving sdumitriu - (16:47): jvelociter: Close XWIKI-5104 ? jvelociter - (16:47): yes, I wanted to see if it would break some UI tests first jvelociter - (16:47): since I did not run them on my computer sdumitriu left at 16:56 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds qwebirc69149 joined #xwiki at 16:56 sburjan left at 16:57 (Ping timeout: 250 seconds qwebirc68091 joined #xwiki at 16:57 AaronO joined #xwiki at 16:57 AaronO - (16:58): Wondering if anyone here has install xwiki into WebSphere? AaronO - (16:58): We are trying that and getting an error at startup time of the application. jvelociter - (17:03): AaronO: Hi. What's the error ? jvelociter - (17:03): (also what version of XWiki and WS are you using ?) AaronO - (17:03): Several failed to lookup component errors; AaronO - (17:03): [10/29/10 9:47:18:605 CDT] 00000029 webapp        E com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.webapp.WebApp notifyServletContextCreated SRVE0283E: Exception caught while initializing context: {0} AaronO - (17:03):  java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to find the Observation Manager component jvelociter - (17:03): can you paste the full stack trace on pastebin.com ? AaronO - (17:04): Its WAS7 and Xwiki 2.5 AaronO - (17:05): http://pastebin.com/2QxfG9vD abusenius joined #xwiki at 17:06 jvelociter - (17:10): AaronO: have you tried with XWiki 2.4.4 ?
